All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.lookup.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.settings.SettingsTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.PackagePathTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.traits.LanguageTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.traits.TryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.resource.ResourceTrait
public abstract class MicroserviceRestService extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable
Base class for KivaKit microservice REST applications. Microservlets can be installed with mount(MicroservletRestPath, Microservlet). (MicroservletRequest handlers must be installed with mount(String, HttpMethod, Class) in the Microservice.onInitialize() method. The gsonFactory() method can be overridden to provide an application-specific Gson serializer. The openApiInfo() class can optionally be overridden to provide OpenAPI details beyond those provided by the Microservice via MicroserviceMetadata.

Internal Details - Flow of Control

  1. Initializing
    1. MicroserviceRestService creates a MicroservletJettyFilterPlugin
    2. In the Initializable.onInitialize() method, mount*() methods are used to bind MicroservletRequest handlers to paths
  2. Receiving requests
    1. An HTTP request is made to the JettyMicroservletFilter installed by MicroservletJettyFilterPlugin
    2. The JettyMicroservletFilter.doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse, FilterChain) resolves any Microservlet mounted on the request path. If no microservlet is found, the request is passed to the next Filter in the filter chain
    3. Request parameters are processed
      1. If the HTTP request method is GET, any path or query parameters are turned into a JSON object, which is processed as if it were posted
      2. If the HTTP request method is POST, then the posted JSON object is read by JettyMicroservletRequest.readObject(Class)
      3. If the HTTP request method is DELETE, any path or query parameters are turned into a JSON object, which is processed as if it were posted
  3. Handling requests
    1. The Microservlet.onRequest(MicroservletRequest) method is called
  4. Producing a response
    1. The request handler's return value is passed to JettyMicroserviceResponse.writeObject(MicroservletResponse), which:
      1. Validates the response object by calling Validatable.validator() and Validator.validate(Listener)
      2. Converts the object to JSON using the Gson object provided by gsonFactory()
      3. Writes the JSON object to the servlet response output stream
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • initialize

      public final void initialize()
      Mount OpenAPI request handler and initialize the rest application. This method cannot be overridden. Override Initializable.onInitialize() instead.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable

    • microservice

      public Microservice<?> microservice()
      Returns:
      The microservice to which this rest application belongs

    • mount

      public void mount​(MicroservletRestPath path, Microservlet<?,​?> microservlet)
      Mounts the given microservlet on the given path
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the microservlet. If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/". For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      microservlet - The microservlet to mount

    • mount

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest,​ Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mount​(com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.values.version.Version version, String path, MicroserviceRestService.HttpMethod method, Class<Request> requestType)

    • mount

      public <Request extends MicroservletRequest,​ Response extends MicroservletResponse> void mount​(String path, MicroserviceRestService.HttpMethod method, Class<Request> requestType)
      Mounts the given request class on the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the given microservlet request handler (requestType). If the path is not absolute (doesn't start with a '/'), it is prefixed with: "/api/[major.version].[minor.version]/", where the version is retrieved from Microservice.version(). For example, the path "users" in microservlet version 3.1 will resolve to "/api/3.1/users", and the path "/users" will resolve to "/users".
      method - The HTTP method to which the microservlet should respond
      requestType - The type of the request

    • mountAll

      public void mountAll​(com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.internal.protocols.MicroservletMountTarget target)
      Not public API

      Mounts all paths that have been mounted on this REST service on the given mount target.

      statistics - The statistics

    • openApiInfo

      public io.swagger.v3.oas.models.info.Info openApiInfo()
